text:
Hey,
I'm trying to create third party app to use calling CRM. I have created app in express.js and connected to HubSpot.
Now trying to install calling sdk but it gives error like window is not define in calling sdk node modules.
Anyone able to point me in the right direction?
Sounds like you’re using a client lib which only supports client-side API requests. Look at HubSpot’s v3 node api. <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs>

Hello everyone,
I am trying to follow tutorial part 2 on the website: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-2>
And I am facing next issue:
1. Missing KAFKA environment variables in the main repository: <https://github.com/zman81988/idea-tracker/tree/timeline>
2. Can't start the container in the docker: HubSpot_service    | Error: Cannot find module 'kafka-node'
Maybe someone also had this issues, may you please help me?

Hello, I am not sure where to post my question, so I am going to post it here. Any help that I could get would be greatly appreciated.

I am trying to build a custom code block in a workflow to indefinitely hold a record in a delay until a property value was updated in salesforce. Does anyone know the best path forward to achieve this?

<@U021QM20QN9> Hi Holly, a couple of ideas, but you may have already considered them:
[1] Pause for a generous amount of time (e.g. using setTimeout) -- this HubSpot article says your custom code action has max 20 seconds to execute, so keep that in mind: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
[2] Call the Salesforce API directly within the custom code action. Assuming the Salesforce API gives you a useful response, you could potentially use a promise to continue after response is received from Salesforce.
Is that helpful at all?
For your second suggestion, would it still fall under the 20 second limit?
<@U021QM20QN9> I'd imagine so. I haven't worked with Salesforce APIs before, but I'm pretty sure this would be loads of time.
Yeah, it would need to hold past that 20 second limit, until the salesforce record was updated. Which could take 30-45 days.

<@U021QM20QN9> Ahhh I see. Depending on the time-sensitivity of the workflow continuing once the property has been updated in Salesforce, you could maybe consider adding sequential delays followed each time by a call to Salesforce API (via custom code action) to see if the property has been updated.
Can I undo the deletion of a form in HubSpot? Just deleted one that would be a HUGE pain to redo
I’d call support.  They saved me after an accidental file manager deletion recently
But how can I get events on the server-side when the user makes any call from HubSpot contact
